avalancheActivity.highlights: Not much snow in the region and older snow in upper parts is considered stable.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Not much snow in the region and older snow in upper parts is considered stable after mild weather and rain recently.

travelAdvisory.comment: Little snow is left in the lowlands in most parts and ongoing melt is expected in the next couple of days with rain, warm weather and strong winds. Some wind slabs may form in the uppermost part of mountains.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Little snow in most parts and ongoing warm weather will increase snow melt in the next few days.

weatherForecast.highlights: Austlægar áttir næstu daga, hvasst og blautt í veðri á svæðinu.

avalancheActivity.highlights: Generally rather little snow but wind slabs high in the mountains which can be unstable. Increased likelihood of wet avalanches.

snowpackStructure.highlights: It is generally rather snow-free, but snow has managed to accumulate on the sheltered sides of the mountains after prolonged northeasterly winds and snow showers. The snow has melted and settled lower down in the mountains. At the highest elevations there has been some additional accumulation, but snow has also subsided. No snow pits have been dug to assess stability, but it should be assumed that recent wind slabs may be unstable. Wet snow conditions also expected next days in warm weather

travelAdvisory.comment: Little snow is left in the lowlands in most parts and ongoing melt is expected in the next couple of days with rain, warm weather and strong winds. Some wind slabs may form in the uppermost part of mountains.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Little snow in most parts and ongoing warm weather will increase snow melt in the next few days.

weatherForecast.highlights: Hvöss austan-norðaustan átt með éljum/skafrenningi efst í fjöllum en rigningu á láglendi og upp í miðjar hlíðar

avalancheActivity.highlights: Wind slabs may form in the mountains during strong easterlies this week. Older snow has strengthened in mild weather.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Wind slabs may be present in the upper elevations but have likely diminished in the mild weather. Continued easterly snow showers in the coming days could increase wind-slab formation on south- and west-facing aspects.

travelAdvisory.comment: Little snow is left in the lowlands in most parts and ongoing melt is expected in the next couple of days with rain, warm weather and strong winds. Some wind slabs may form in the uppermost part of mountains.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Little snow in most parts and ongoing warm weather will increase snow melt in the next few days.

weatherForecast.highlights: Ríkjandi norðaustanátt og éljagangur til fjalla næstu daga.

avalancheActivity.comment: Three avalanches released in Norðfjörður on Dec 5th. A few small avalanches released in Norðfjörður on Nov 29th.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Considerable amounts of new snow high in the mountains. Snow has melted or subsided at lower elevations. Limited information on stability, and new snow should be considered unstable at firs

snowpackStructure.highlights: Considerable new snow is present in the upper parts of the mountains, and wind slabs have formed after prolonged northeast winds with snow showers and drifting snow. It should be assumed that the wind slabs are initially unstable, as there has been no opportunity to assess stability. Snow in the lower parts of the mountains has melted or settled.

travelAdvisory.comment: Little snow is left in the lowlands in most parts and ongoing melt is expected in the next couple of days with rain, warm weather and strong winds. Some wind slabs may form in the uppermost part of mountains.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Little snow in most parts and ongoing warm weather will increase snow melt in the next few days.

weatherForecast.highlights: Gengur í hvassa A-átt á fimmtudag með talsverðri rigningu upp í fjalla hæð. SA-átt og skúrir á föstudag. Hvöss SV-átt á laugardag og styttir upp. Milt í veðri
